sample.description:
PHerc. 332 is a rolled Herculaneum papyrus from the [Biblioteca Nazionale di Napoli](https://www.bnnonline.it/it/121/officina-dei-papiri-ercolanesi), carbonized during the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD. It was scanned at the [Diamond Light Source](https://www.diamond.ac.uk) in Oxfordshire, UK.

It is a smaller scroll known as a *midollo* (marrow), a remnant from physical unwrapping of the larger original. Its small size enabled scanning at extremely high resolution (3.24um).

PHerc. Paris 1 Fr 39 is a fragment of a Herculaneum papyrus, carbonized during the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD. It was scanned at the [Diamond Light Source](https://www.diamond.ac.uk) in Oxfordshire, UK.

Originally held back for automated scoring in the [Kaggle ink detection competition](https://kaggle.com/competitions/vesuvius-challenge-ink-detection/), this fragment has since been released.

See also: [EduceLab-Scrolls paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.02084), [EduceLab 2023 Info Sheet](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I6JNrR6A9pMdANbn6uAuXbcDNwjk8qZ2/view?usp=sharing).

sample.description:
PHerc. 1667 Cr 1 Fr 3 is a fragment from the same scroll as PHerc. 1667 (Scroll 4), from the [Biblioteca Nazionale di Napoli](https://www.bnnonline.it/it/121/officina-dei-papiri-ercolanesi). It was partially opened in 1987 via the Oslo method. It was scanned at the [Diamond Light Source](https://www.diamond.ac.uk) in Oxfordshire, UK.

Listed on [Chartes.it](https://www.chartes.it/index.php?r=document/view&id=1691).

See also: [EduceLab-Scrolls paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.02084), [EduceLab 2023 Info Sheet](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I6JNrR6A9pMdANbn6uAuXbcDNwjk8qZ2/view?usp=sharing).

sample.description:
PHerc. 1667 is a rolled Herculaneum papyrus from the [Biblioteca Nazionale di Napoli](https://www.bnnonline.it/it/121/officina-dei-papiri-ercolanesi), carbonized during the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD. It was scanned at the [Diamond Light Source](https://www.diamond.ac.uk) in Oxfordshire, UK.

It is similar in size to PHerc. 332 (Scroll 3).

acquisition.comment: wba11 = Mo 1.30mm, wba14 = Ag 0.10mm

sample.description:
PHerc. Paris 4 is a rolled Herculaneum papyrus from the [Institut de France](https://www.institutdefrance.fr/en/home/), carbonized during the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD. It was scanned at the [Diamond Light Source](https://www.diamond.ac.uk) in Oxfordshire, UK.

This is the scroll for which we have by far the most segments, where the [first letters](https://scrollprize.org/firstletters) were discovered and the [2023 Grand Prize](https://scrollprize.org/grandprize) was claimed.

acquisition.comment: wba11 = Mo 1.30mm, wba14 = Ag 0.10mm

sample.description:
PHerc. 172 is a rolled Herculaneum papyrus from the [Bodleian Library](https://www.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/home) in Oxford, carbonized during the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD. It was scanned at the [Diamond Light Source](https://www.diamond.ac.uk) in Oxfordshire, UK.

It is similar in size to PHerc. Paris 4 (Scroll 1).
